website_summaries.verdict: A favorite among users for its low cost, EyeProtect feature, no-frame appearance, brilliant colors, and sharp details.
pros: Matte finish reduces glare for strain-free use in either bright or low light
Includes a VGA cable, and has additional inputs for HDMI and DVI
Clean look makes multi-monitor setup seamless for both work and gaming
cons: Some users would like the ability to tilt the monitor more
height also not adjustable, so may require extra require riser for comfortable eye-level placement

customer_reviews.title: How to fix ghosting!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and enjoy them quite a bit. A few reviews complain about ghosting, which I experienced until I realized in the default settings on the monitors had "overdrive" or "OD" on. As long as you disable this feature you will no longer have ghosting trouble! Hope this helps anyone who bought these and was disappointed, I saw nothing online about fixing this issue other than figuring it out myself by chance.
customer_reviews.author: Rayna

customer_reviews.title: Bad choice
customer_reviews.text: Every now and again my screen blacks out, but just for a moment, less than a second, (think screenshot on your phone) and it's really weirding me out. It happens in irregular inconsistent intervals, sometimes days in between, sometimes only 5 minutes apart. I changed all the cables and adapters, I wrote back in Sept/Oct for a replacement but Amazon redirected me to the manufacturer. I sent the monitor to the Acer support center, and they sent me back the monitor with the diagnostic was no observed issues. So I bought this monitor to have an upgrade but wasn't a good choice. And here I'm with an annoying black flashing screen
customer_reviews.author: yohi

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor and value! NOT FOR MACBOOK PRO 2017 without hassle.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for 1080 monitor. Clear picture Simple simple assembly (or taking it apart) Strong base Works beautifully with MacBook Air REVISED AND WARNING FOR MACBOOK PRO 2017 USERS: The monitor, which worked beautifully with a MacBook Air, does NOT work with a MacBook Pro 2017. Acer must service it with a firmware update. You have to send the monitor back to them. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Morris Massel

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning monitor and bad Acer Support
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these monitors for a dual monitor set up. The buttons did not work on 1 of the monitors. I filed a complaint with acer and they advised I had to pay for the initial shipping to them, which was approximately $90 to pay UPS for packaging and ground shipping. Acer refused to reimburse me even though it was not my fault the monitor didn’t function properly. The cost to ship it to them was nearly the cost of buying a new monitor.
customer_reviews.author: St6stringer1

customer_reviews.title: I have went through 5 monitors already
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 about 2 years ago for my first gaming build as my side monitors. So far I've had to replace or buy new ones because all of the seem to have dying pixels, the screens start to flicker and are unusable. Acer makes you pay for return shipping to replace or fix the monitor. Which is ridiculous because it costs like 20-30$. But after getting pissed at them, they agreed to cover all shipping costs. I will be getting different brand monitors once these ones die out too.
customer_reviews.author: Davit Petrosyan

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra $20 and go with a better brand, you won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this model. I purchased two, and after only a year of light use they both are nearly unusable. After spending the money to ship to their repair center (a shipping label isn't provided), I got the panel back not repaired with a scratch on the casing. Spend the extra $20 and go with a better brand, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan W.

customer_reviews.title: Head's up before you buy this monitor for a modern computer
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this is a decent monitor for the price point. Does the job just fine for working from home. Be advised, the monitor ships with a VGA monitor cable as of October 2020. The VGA standard came out in 1987 and was replaced by DVI in 1999 which eventually led to the modern HDMI interface as the industry standard. Very few modern computers ship with a VGA port, almost all of them ship with HDMI. You will likely need to purchase a HDMI cable in addition to this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: E Michael

customer_reviews.title: Backlight Bleeds Through Screen
customer_reviews.text: Warning before you buy: This monitor has a well known backlight bleeding problem that appears to be present in everyone's purchase of this model monitor. It's still a good deal if you are viewing an image with full color borders but if you are watching a show with dark corners around the edge in a dark room it's pretty apparent. I think I can get over this problem as the price was so loe, however.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: just ok
customer_reviews.text: I use this monitor for work, not gaming. The size of this and its price are terrific. It easily holds to 8x11 documents side-by-side, and there are no difficulties transporting it (light and easy to set up) which I occasionally do. However, I have spent LOTS of time trying to brighten the whites, but to no avail. It's really dim compared to a computer screen and to another external monitor I have (same price range). It seems like there should be a setting or adjustment beyond the ones I've found (picture, mode, manual adjust), but I don't think so. I would appreciate any advice if you have found it differently. em
customer_reviews.author: Waitin' on the Cubs...

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for low price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for my home office. Absolutely thrilled with their performance. I'm not a gamer so I wasn't expecting 4K quality considering the price but was pleasantly surprised. Picture quality is excellent; text displays sharply and color quality exceeds my expectations. Interestingly, even though they are 23.4 inch monitors they "present" much larger. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dillard

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: I am supper impressed with how great the quality for price is on this monitor. My kids have MacBooks and I felt like having an extra, larger screen would be handy for virtual learning. It was super easy to set up (took maybe 10 min) and worked perfectly. Great picture quality and works well for a dual monitor environment.
customer_reviews.author: Chandi

customer_reviews.title: Bought one last year and one this year....
customer_reviews.text: Same model, same settings, everything. The one I bought last year looks good and the new one looks terrible. The contrast ratio, brightness, everything looks worse on the new model. The whites are yellow on the new one and cool on the old one despite both being on 'warm'. I have them side by side at the same PC so its really noticeable. I am used to monitors having slight variances in color temp but this one is awful. Apparently they went with a cheaper display to reduce cost.
customer_reviews.author: DavidP

customer_reviews.title: Works great for what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife's home office to be a second screen for her Macbook Pro. Have had no issues what so ever. I used a HDMI cable to link them and everything works great. No issues with ghosting or blacking out at random like others. I plan to use as a second screen for my streaming while I game on my new gaming rig that I have built.
customer_reviews.author: mchone14

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with the color, brightness, and size. The controls are hard to manipulate. I don't think I've succeeded yet, but the balance seems fine right out of the box. The assembly is a bit tricky. If you have the angles right, no force is needed. I got it on the second try. The monitor is stable and does tilt back a little ways. You'll have to use a strong shove, and you might think you're breaking something but you won't.
customer_reviews.author: MindKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Terrible - Started showing sparkling effect after 3 days of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor as I need it to continue doing my job from home (during the quarantine we are under related to COVID-19). I opened it and set it up and worked well for 2 days and then on the 3rd day it started sparkling all over the screen making it very hard to see the display and complete my work / continuing to do my job using this monitor. I have tried to get a replacement but the only thing offered to me is to get a replacement 2 months from now. Do not buy this monitor, it is not worth it as it was not cheap and it only worked properly for 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Acer R240HY monitor review
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely pleased with the performance of this monitor. I bought this monitor for my new ASUS desktop computer and hooked it up thru an hdmi to dva cable. I researched the reviews carefully before purchase online. I was a little worried that some reviewers complained about light escaping along the edges in IPS monitors and also missing pixels but so far I have not noticed either problem on mine. I would have given it 5 stars but for the hidden adjustments under the right bottom which I found to be very difficult to operate. The stand was very sturdy and easy to assemble and adjust the tilt.
customer_reviews.author: Bill M.

customer_reviews.title: Won’t even turn on.  Broken right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival. I work in I/T, so it’s not like I may have plugged a cord in wrong. It would not even acknowledge that it was getting power. I tested the power supply with my multimeter and received the expected 19 volts going into the monitor. Very frustrating. In the middle of a pandemic and the monitor I ordered to do my job remotely won’t turn on. And, at this point, anything decent and affordable is already sold out. So I’m stuck with just a laptop screen for now. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony from MS

customer_reviews.title: 25” Monitor Supports VESA
customer_reviews.text: Product description states that the 25" monitor does not support VESA. That is incorrect. The R271 (27”) supports VESA. So, I figured that the 25” would also support VESA. Prior to making a VESA mount purchase, I had asked the question under the product description. Q: Does this fit Acer R251 A: Hello! Thank you for your question! This adapter is compatible. Thank you for checking! By Support on June 17, 2020 I purchased MOUNT-AR240H. MOUNT-AR240H VESA Adapter for Acer and Viewsonic Monitors  Also purchased: VIVO Item model number: FBA_STAND-V001 VIVO Single LCD Monitor Desk Mount Stand Fully Adjustable/Tilt/Articulating for 1 Screen 13" to 27" (S  Works perfectly for my New WFH setup!!
customer_reviews.author: TROY

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product support
customer_reviews.text: I received the monitor quickly ( a couple of days) and was excited to set it up. It needed the stand attached to the scvreen. Unfortunatly the bracket that would make this possible was missing. The reason I'm giving the unit five stars is the wonderful response of product support. I called them and told them of the problem and they immediately sent a replacement. I sent the broken monitor back the next day and got the replacement the day after that. Also I love the monitory. It is replacing an old Acer that I have had for many years that finally died. I didn't know knew monitors could be so much better at half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bartly

customer_reviews.title: Working well so far
customer_reviews.text: I got this in a pinch for my new wfh life as my other 20" monitor started dying and it has been very solid in the month or so I've had it, using it 5 days a week 9 hours a day. Would buy again, but maybe when the price comes back to normal. So far the screen has worked well.
customer_reviews.author: John McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Who cares? No VESA mount!
customer_reviews.text: Monitor is very thin* with 1/8" bezel on 3 sides. Image is very nice but limited. (*The top 3/4 is extremely thin: ~1/4". Would be GREAT for flush mount applications except the bottom 1/4 swells out to a full 1"! Seriously, what is the point of this design?) However, the monitor is useless to me because it comes with no VESA mounting holes OR adapter. This is a fundamental capability and inexcusable they left it off. 3rd party adapters cost $30+ and are shoddy hacks. Just spend the $30-$50 on a better monitor.
customer_reviews.author: vardelda

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I was using a 10 year old monitor and that one blew up on me. I just recently got this one and it changes so much. Even though the size I got is slightly smaller than my older one, the borders of the monitor are EXTREMELY thin, and the color looks good. I've noticed it can be slightly darker even with brightness turned up but maybe i'm just used to my other monitor. No issues, no complaints, and it'd look really nice if you had a dual or 3 monitor setup. I recommend. Edit: I've been having a few issues, it closes games sometimes, and the screen wont turn on at other times... Annoying. But it "works".
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for price - especially when you need many monitors
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with the quality of this monitor. I am very picky about my monitors. I have 3 set-up at home, so price per monitor was an important consideration. I have bought additional Acer monitors for my kids for school from home this fall. Kids will likely end up needing 2 monitors with online school, so this brand is great price point if you are needing to purchase many monitors at once
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Poor brightness and keeps going on/off
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Acer monitor and haven't been terribly impressed. The brightness levels are unimpressive, so if you are doing tasks such as photography, pick a different monitor. The monitor also started randomly going off and on momentarily after 6 months or so. I'm probably still in the warranty period, but I'm not sure I want to bother getting a replacement. That said, the monitor is lightweight and setup without issues. The monitor doesn't seem flimsy, so if it worked properly and gave good brightness/contrast, I image it would otherwise have a long life in my office. But alas.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: NO SUPPORT FOR OS X
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a second monitor for a macbook and a surface pro. Unfortunately, Acer provides ZERO support for use with any apple ecosystem device. It works great for video, unfortunately I didn't try using the monitor's built in speakers until now... and while I can choose the option to output sound through my monitor, NOTHING comes out. That, plus the problem that you will have to buy an adapter in order to mount this to any VESA mount, and I cannot recommend this monitor for people using non-windows devices or wanting to mount to a monitor riser or other VESA situation.
customer_reviews.author: RecoverInBeautyTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Blurry - hard to read text.
customer_reviews.text: I thought the specs sounded good, and I found earlier reviews encouraging; but this monitor is terrible for reading text. It's just so blurry and I can't fix it. I've tried every different resolution setting and the text remains blurry. It's straining my eyes. I bought a computer monitor because my job involves reading and writing all day and I wanted something easier on the eyes than a small laptop screen. This was NOT a solution. It actively hurts to look at. Extremely disappointed; will be returning. Get what you pay for I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor!
customer_reviews.text: This was an excellent way to get a pair of nice monitors for my work-at-home setup. The monitors are very light, but the base keeps them very stable. I would give them five stars, but the monitors have external power bricks. It makes it very hard to have a very clean look to your space, since the bricks are hard to hide. I had to take away a star for that, but I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KARL LEWIS

customer_reviews.title: Great....till just outside the return window.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until this week....just one week outside the return/exchange window. Today I fire it up and have a row of dead pixels about an inch from the bottom bezel. Stuck pixel videos/repairs did not help after running for over an hour on loop. Other than the dead pixels it has been a decent monitor for the price-- one that I will now have to replace before my OCD gets the best of me and I throw it out a window.
customer_reviews.author: USAF99

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What we wanted
customer_reviews.text: I will second what other reviews have written about ghosting. Disable the OD feature and we have had no problems with Ghosting. We have used it for a few weeks now with no problems. No on and off experiences, no restarting but never turning on problems, no ghosting. I'm an every day user but I'm not an expert on screens for a computer. I just want to be able to turn it on and it works. I want it to have a nice picture that look realistic to my expectations. I want it to be sturdy and not have the feel of breaking if I tap on it. This meets that criteria.
customer_reviews.author: apoem

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck, 100%
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought two of these monitors (as shown in the picture), and now have a third one on the way. They are a fantastic monitor, well worth the almost $200 price tag, and here's why. PROS: -Quick response time and smooth, 60fps 120hz frame rate, perfect for gaming, entertainment, and work use -Wonderful image quality, never has 1080p looked so good. The IPS on these monitors makes the resolution look and feel much higher -Looks beautiful, aesthetically pleasing in any setting, especially when paired with a twin monitor to see those tiny, tiny bezels CONS: -Plastic casing bends and flexes when the desk is bumped into, just enough to shake the monitors a bit -literally nothing else
customer_reviews.author: Luke Mocherman

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: In terms of quality of image and size, it works for me. I need a larger screen because of my neck hurting causing headaches while working. SO this help and for the price the quality of image is great. My only concern it that sometimes the screen turn purple when I turn it on or if left on after turning my laptop off and then turning on. All I do is turn it off then on again to get it back to normal screen. So it's not too inconvenient but it is a concern and I have no idea why that happens. But over all I'm ok with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tamercindy

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor all around
customer_reviews.text: Got this monitor for gaming and working from home. It was carefully packaged so when it arrived there was no concern for damages. The product was very easy to install and set up. Overall the quality of the picture is good for what I paid for. The stand is a little flimsy, but after setting up I don’t have a need to move it around. For people looking for the best quality monitor I’d recommend spending that extra buck for the quality and performance. Anyone looking for a standard monitor this will do well. The simplicity of the monitor set up as picture quality makes this ideal for most people looking for a gaming and home monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Jaron Tsukamoto

customer_reviews.title: Monitor is exactly what you'd expect at this price. Minus one star for no mounting pattern.
customer_reviews.text: This is a sub $200 27in monitor. It's exactly what I expected. Brightness is 4/5, color is 4/5, response for casual work or browsing is 4/5.... the monitor as a whole is just 4/5 stars. But what really lost a star here was that this box doesn't include a mount pattern or include a mount adapter for third party mounting systems ($30 extra expense). I knew this before I made my purchase so it wasn't a surprise at all, but it should be included or built into the platform. Until it does, it's still just 4/5 stars.... Yes, I would recommend this monitor! As a whole, the price is right for what the R271 brings to the table.
customer_reviews.author: Chase A.

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the others
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this monitor! We have two monitors: one of them was this monitor, and the other was a crappier one. The crappy one finally died so we started shopping for another one. We went through two other monitors we bought from some classified ads, but neither of them could compare at all. The colors looked all weird and they had huge bezels. This monitor just made them look bad. So we ended up buying another one, and have been very satisfied with our purchase. I even love the BASE of it. Seriously, the little round base is awesome. It's so minimal. Unfortunately it doesn't slide up and down, but it does tilt. I totally recommend this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: great monitor!
customer_reviews.text: My old monitor was more of a square shape. I love this widescreen monitor! I can open 2 different documents, web pages or files side-by-side on the screen. The only thing I would change is that I wish the various buttons for operating it - especially the power button - was on the front. Trying to make adjustments can be a pain since you can't see which button you are pressing, but once I got the settings to where I wanted them, I shouldn't have to use them much. And since there is a blue light next to where the power button is, I can easily find that to turn it on and off.
customer_reviews.author: VAM

customer_reviews.title: It seems like the cables are more likely to get bent and ...
customer_reviews.text: It's weird that the video connectors stick straight out the back, as opposed to most monitors that have the cables hanging straight down. It seems like the cables are more likely to get bent and break the connectors this way, if you ever push the monitor back against a wall or something. Other than that, it's a good monitor with VGA, DVI, and HDMI connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Monitor stopped working after a couple months and now the screen remains black when powered on.
customer_reviews.text: Monitor stopped working after a couple months and now the screen remains black when powered on. Disappointed, will not be purchasing products from the Acer brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one
customer_reviews.text: I love this display. I purchased one from Best Buy about a year ago and decided to pick up another so I have 2 full screen displays. Love the thin bezels and could really care less about the screen 'bleeding' or whatever some of the commenters are saying... I'm not typically staring at a black screen hoping that it was more black. I'm using this on both Mac and Windows for coding, homework and typical home usage. I haven't played any games on these.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth much more than the price!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? This monitor is just fantastic! The color production is totally on point [especially at this price outdoing itself]. The IPS display delivers impeccably [hardly notice any IPS glow.]. It can be overclocked to 75 hertz for a bit more speed. The monitor is practically bezel-less and really comfortable to look at. The monitor itself is truly beautiful and durable. It has a small user friendly menu which you probably don't even need to touch as its already well calibrated. It is very energy efficient and flicker free. Acer you've certainly outdone yourself with this one. No wonder it is practically a best seller on Amazon. I am truly a happy owner!! :)
customer_reviews.author: TechlovingMoses

customer_reviews.title: At First Great, but a year later...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monitor back in January 2019. It was perfectly fine, but it appears the quality doesn't seem to be able to last for too long. I am a student as well as a gamer. For some reason on the right side of the monitor screen appears to have a crack or more so a line of dead pixels developing.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Peters

customer_reviews.title: the product is low quality and has no speaker!
customer_reviews.text: the display has horrible scratches on it (shipped to me that way) it has no speakers,and is low quality and i should have send it back but was out of town when the time (return) was still doable.wish. i did not waste my money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Internal Speakers Misleading Description
customer_reviews.text: This monitor has no internal speakers. Nowhere in the description of this product does it mention that there are no external speakers. I struggled for nearly an hour trying to figure out why I could not get audio through HDMI. I'm absolutely enraged that I have to buy an additional piece of hardware just to make a $150 monitor even functional. This is on Acer too--why even manufacture a monitor without something as basic as speakers?
customer_reviews.author: Anna Young

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a Lenovo laptop and wanted a larger monitor. There are many different ways to assess a monitor. I needed the basics. I don't know what is necessary for gaming so I can't speak to that. I have a basic nvidia card because sometimes I do graphic design. For the average consumer like me this is the right price for nothing special but a monitor that works well. I am completely satisfied with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: V AA

customer_reviews.title: You want cheap? You get cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this monitor. A month or two after purchase and the screen is already failing. Constant visual artifacts are displayed at the edges of objects and the color temperatures are inaccurate and very poor. The construction is thin and flimsy. Going to have to replace it soon and have no intention of ever purchasing another Acer product. If you're looking for a decent cheapish monitor, I recommend Phillips. I purchased one about two weeks before this Acer and am very happy with it. I would have two Phillips right now, but they were sold out when I was ready to order another. Made a bad choice and ordered the Acer.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Laird

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!  But needs HDMI cable and need to mention that there are no built in speakers
customer_reviews.text: Very nice monitor, especially for the price. HOWEVER, who needs a VGA cable anymore? They should ditch those and include an HDMI cable instead. ALSO, it needs to be noted prominently that there are no built-in speakers. You will have to purchase computer speakers if you use the HDMI connection. I would have purchased a different model with built in speakers if I had realized it. So that will clutter up the workspace a bit adding those.
customer_reviews.author: JustMeee

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best for Text on HDMI
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these for my home desktop. Generally they are great. Bright and function well. I have one plugged into a DVI and the other an HDMI port. The DVI one works great and is clear. The HDMI one looks largely the same, but the text on that one is less crisp. It seems to be the cable/port type and not the monitor itself. I'm not 100% sure that this isn't an issue with my computer's display adapter. In the past I had a DVI and a D-sub analog for monitor connections and the image was essentially the same. Anyway, something to watch out for when making your choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C

customer_reviews.title: Stand takes up too much room
customer_reviews.text: Decent monitor at $99 however the base of the stand sticks out 3.5 inches. This is valuable workspace and ridiculous. If you are not using base stand and will use mounts (like I will now have to purchase as extra) then sure this could work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: FRUSTRATED - ONE WAY TO MOUNT THIS THING
customer_reviews.text: This is a good enough monitor for the price, no issues there but: THERE ARE NO THREADED INSERTS IN THE BACK FOR ALTERNATE MOUNTING ON A DUAL STAND, ETC. VERY FRUSTRATING. I'll be keeping it but c'mon, that's a $1.00 addition at the factory that I'd pay $5 for. I found an adapter that is supposed to work (HumanCentric VESA Mount Adapter Bracket) for $29.99 but I already attached the stand and I don't see an easy release. Last, be very careful if you buy an adaptor: - - - - - - The bracket does NOT fit the the Acer R240HY Abmidx - the bracket only fits the R240HY bidx WHY DOES IT HAVE TO BE SO DIFFICULT?????
customer_reviews.author: Mike Borfitz

customer_reviews.title: Poor Brightness
customer_reviews.text: I purchased ACER "R240HY bidx" 23.8" AND ACER "R240HY Abmidx" 23.8" monitors. There is a clear difference in the picture quality. The screen on R240HY is less bright despite the adjustments. If I view both the monitors together wearing polarized shades, I see blank screen on "R240HY bidx" but I can see the picture on "R240HY Abmidx" monitor (dual screen) According to the description, both the monitors have same spec except for "R240HY Abmidx" has built in speakers. The monitors were purchased together but arrived from different locations. Waste of time and money. I threw away the boxes so can hardly return it.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: No VESA mount capability
customer_reviews.text: I dislike giving 1 star reviews. I purchased this monitor along with a two monitor desk mount to replace one of my monitors in a two monitor setup. Never did I imagine this monitor wouldn't be VESA mount capable. Of course I cannot return the monitor since I opened it and I cannot return the desk mount without paying 1/3 of the purchase price to ship it back to Amazon. So, beware, this monitor, regardless of any other features, is not VESA mount capable. I seriously cannot believe it nor understand the reasoning behind this. For my needs, this earns it 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: PJ Photo

customer_reviews.title: HDMI sound connection
customer_reviews.text: Have had this monitor for two days and JUST got the sound coming to it. For the benefit of others....if you cannot get sound in the HDMI connection all you have to do is update your audio drivers. Done everything else but that and as soon as drivers had updated, sound came through speakers! For what was paid for this monitor has GOT to be an absolute BARGAIN! First connected using the VGA connector and was really surprised at the depth of colors. But when trying out the HDMI connection..WOW! The difference is significant in appearance! Am go glad I purchased this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Gibney

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This was a fine, cheap monitor, until it stopped working. The monitor will no longer accept input from an HDMI cable. I have tried 4 different HDMI cables (all of which I know work). I am thoroughly disappointed, both for the inconvenience (I need this for work) and that I wasted $120.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great for working from home
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor so I could work from home during COVID-19. It was a good price and arrived quickly. It is easy to connect, great size, and picture quality is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: SophieF

customer_reviews.title: Very good monitor - for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I really have no complaints about this monitor. Bought it for someone else, but I tested it for a few days. It is your typical Acer monitor. Quick to fire up, easy to setup. Has a quality feel from it you would probably not expect. It is nothing to worship, but it very much worth the price point. Good color, buttons feel nice, you have mounting options, and it is light-weight and solid. Even the inexpensive stand makes it sit well and stable. Good viewing angle. No need to hype it, it is a good monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Marsaeus

customer_reviews.title: Poor stand, BYO HDMI cable
customer_reviews.text: This monitor doesn’t have an adjustable stand. It is too low and the screen tilts slightly forward. I have to put it on a large pot with some coasters wedged under one side so I can see the screen properly. The cords that cane with the screen are useless. You have to buy an hdmi-hdmi cable separately. Lame.
customer_reviews.author: VAcustomer

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best 1080p monitor for its price
customer_reviews.text: This is, by far, the best 1080p monitor I've experienced, especially at its price. It punches WAY above its weight, and in my opinion, blows all of the competition out of the water. I'm running a dual monitor setup, with this Acer replacing my former primary monitor, a similarly-priced 21" 1080p HP. The colouring and vibrancy seems to be slightly better on the HP, but the larger display and comparable quality of this Acer absolutely outweighs those traits, in my opinion. I WILL be buying another one in the future to pair with this one!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 27 inch monitor for our home office after ordering the 21.5 inch monitor last year & for such a reasonable priced monitor - I couldn't be happier. I was not expecting it to be as large as it is but I absolutely LOVE this monitor!! Great picture quality but i am a little bummed that this monitor doesn't have any USB ports on it. It did come with a cord to plug into the hub which i forgot when i got the 21.5 inch monitor. LOVE the monitor!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris&Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive monitor
customer_reviews.text: this monitor can be hooked up with vga cord, DVI or HDMI, which is good. I have seen it work in VGA and HDMI and the picture is great. Don't do gaming so input there. Did not understand the difference in pricing each time I bought another one of these monitors. First price was great, second went up a lot and third was back down again. Anyway, I like the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Peg P.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, light and thin
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic video quality. Monitor is very thin and light. The only reason I only gave 4 stars is because the foot is a bit flimsy and not perfectly level. If you are putting this into a multi monitor situation, you will notice it leans a bit to one side.
customer_reviews.author: LesF

customer_reviews.title: Crisp and Affordable (SOLUTION TO SCREEN CUTTING IN AND OUT)
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it is great. Colors are vivid, Bezels are thin, Input lag is minimal. However, if you're like me, you might have issues with the monitor cutting in and out. This is not a driver issue with your GPU or IGP. It is the monitor. BUT there is a simple fix. You must turn off auto-source (or something like that). Turn off the option that auto detects a source. For some reason the monitor will cut out and look for another source randomly. Turning off this option will eliminate your screen cutting in and out. Other than this minor inconvenience, the monitor is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Liasfur

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. This product doesn’t deserve a rating.
customer_reviews.text: This is BY FAR THE WORST MONITOR EVERY!! I would not recommend this to anyone, especially someone who got hired to work from home. The screen turns on and off non-stop imediatly after it is turned on. I have not had this computer 4 months, and It won’t stay on for anything... this is the worst experience and now I’m looking for a RELIABLE monitor for work... ya gotta do better
customer_reviews.author: BOOMGHOST777

customer_reviews.title: Good price.  I’m don’t care about movie quality
customer_reviews.text: Why pay more for a simple business accounting machine . It shows the numbers and the deposits going to the bank. So good enough. I’m not watching Movies on it So I paid the extra ten bucks for hdmi cables. Monitor arrives on time but no HDMI. Had to go buy some. Now I get a time frame saying they will let me know next week when they are available?? Why ?
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN C. SIMS DDS

customer_reviews.title: Screen Goes Black for 2 seconds
customer_reviews.text: I also had the problem with the screen going black for 2 or 3 seconds at random intervals. I have a basic setup, no special video card. The problem showed up with in the first couple of days. Looked online, found a number of people reporting the problem, but no solution or even a cause of the problem. Returned it for a refund rather than try to fix it. Looked good when it was working, but going black was driving me nuts.
customer_reviews.author: J. Murdoch

customer_reviews.title: This Monitors screen came apart from the frame after two months.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is used for my home based product support business. After two months of use the screen started to pull away from the monitor frame. I contacted Acer and was told that Acer would not send me a replacement. Acer wanted me to send the monitor to them first so they could fix it and then send it back to me. So with the monitor sent out for repair I had to buy a second monitor to keep my business running. Not very good customer service. Note that the replacement monitor i bought was not an Acer product.
customer_reviews.author: George P.

customer_reviews.title: Okay.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor works perfect for what it is built to do. The screen is bright and the colors are vivid. However it does not really meet my needs for a gaming monitor and in the future I will be replacing it. There is no bracket on the back either so you can mount it to the wall or rotating arms. I should have done more research when I was buying stuff for a new gaming pc build. It is still a good monitor but in my opinion, is a good workstation monitor or home office monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Skogdrifr

customer_reviews.title: perfect for wfh
customer_reviews.text: having to pivot to work from home for quarantine, these worked great for what i needed. good price and good quality. could have paid twice as much for the model with a stand that you could move up/down, which didn't seem worth it. instead just bought some amazonbasic risers for 20 bucks which did the trick. liked my first monitor so much that i got a second one.
customer_reviews.author: jack_kerowhack

customer_reviews.title: Intermittently goes dark
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product for the first month. NOW I'm utterly disappointed and would love to return it. It "ghosts" as other users have called it. The monitor goes dark intermittently and completely random. I have the screens set up as extended so I can have my notes up while I zoom conference or teach. Changing the settings haven't seemed to help.
customer_reviews.author: Slacker10071

customer_reviews.title: Very good budget monitor with very little black bleed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent budget 23.8 in computer monitor. It has a tiny amount of black bleed when viewing off axis, but nothing that is overly bothersome. The colors are vibrant and full out of the box with the default settings. The stand limits the tilt somewhat, but it is adjustable within its limited range and works for most desktop viewing situations. Having SVGA, DVI and HDMI input allows options in setup and configuration. The mini audio out is a nice bonus to connect speakers since the monitor does not have built-in ones. Overall, I am quite please with this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Weston

customer_reviews.title: Monitor great - faulty HDMI cable
customer_reviews.text: So far a good monitor for the money. The initial setup was a pain since the included HDMI cable was faulty. Went through multiple reboots and all the settings on the monitor before swapping the included cable with one from the twisted nest of random cords in the back of a drawer. Immediately connected when an old cord was used. Moral of the story -- Included cords are not tested - swap out with known good ones if you experience connection issues.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: I find the setup controls incomprehensible
customer_reviews.text: The monitor itself seems pretty good. The picture quality is good, and it seems to be well made. The documentation, however, is pathetic. The "quick start guide" that comes with it barely tells you anything; The user's manual, available on the Acer website, is at first glance much better, but in practice I didn't find it sufficient to enable me to figure out how to use the setup pushbuttons. They ddn't seem to work according to the descriptions. I'm missing something, somewhere;
customer_reviews.author: sasgw

customer_reviews.title: Great design - get two for an awesome wide screen experience
customer_reviews.text: Bought an Acer laptop so thought an Acer monitor would have the best compatibility. These monitors have very thin side frames so when I put two of them together (they were on sale) the view is flawless. Of course there is a black frame in the middle of the two but hardly noticeable. I'm now spoiled when I use spreadsheets I can now stretch it over the monitors and it's so much more efficient. I think the monitor lighting is good as described as my eyes don't seem to tire from using them.
customer_reviews.author: DiazGuam

customer_reviews.title: If you want a good laugh, you can Google the problem of getting ...
customer_reviews.text: Picture is gorgeous. Still can't figure out how to get the sound to work. It's been 3 days with no sound. I've gotten by, but the tiny little buttons, on the bottom where we can't see, don't seem to do what on-line instructions I found said they would. If you want a good laugh, you can Google the problem of getting the sound/audio to work, and I'm not the first nor only. There's even a YouTube video of some guy explaining by "talking" about how to do it, and several comments from people: "But, we can't hear you!!!!". I couldn't either!
customer_reviews.author: Movie Fan

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: There are 6 tiny buttons on the bottom the first 2 are the only ones that worked. I did not need the frustration!
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitors=excellent!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent monitors! Bought 2 odd them month ago to use for day trading the market. These replaced 3 10 year old 21 inch monitors that has all these years....were top of line Samsung's back then. These IPS screens are amazing! Are clear, bright and amazing screen details,and from most any angle, as advertised. After having these, at this great price, wonder why did not do this long time ago. Only negative is that there in no VESA attachment on back of monitors to mount. That is a minor drawback though, and the link below describes how a company is making an adaptor now! A huge record buy for all.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this monitor since May 2017. The monitor itself looks gorgeous, thin, light weight, and zero frame as advertised. The image is nice and sharp.The power consumption is beyond my expectation. When in operation the monitor itself only consumes around 10~12W. If you want to mount this monitor on a stand please be aware that this 24-inch model doesn't have the universal VESA mounting holes in the back instead you will need to get a mounting bracket. After all, I would recommend this monitor to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Budget Monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a good budget monitor. Absolutely no issues with it. Need to be aware that the monitor does NOT come with built in speakers though. Also, the settings buttons on the monitor are too close together and the monitor does not raise up and down although you can adjust the tilt up and down on the stand. The bottom line is, this could be the monitor for you if you are looking for a basic 24" decent quality monitor on a budget. It works just fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: very good deal for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I tried few other brands within last 2 months because my old screen died, and they weren't accurate in white, colors, black. So I stopped on this one. As white color is white, black is black and colors seem accurate only small issue is backlight - there is little bleeding when you watch dark movies, it doesn't bother much. Also came with HDMI cable. comes with pretty long and nice stand able to rotate up and down. Also have ECO mode in the setting.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Acer has this thing down pat!
customer_reviews.text: Once again, Acer answers the call. Purchased this as a replacement for my second monitor since my old Acer was finally giving up the ghost. (10 years seems like a reasonable lifespan in this day and age) Up and running within about 15 minutes of the UPS delivery. All of the required adapters and plugs, which was great appreciated. Even included a VGA adapter in case I didn't have an HDMI port on my PC. Well packaged. Easy to assemble. Lightweight. No instructions required, although there's an info packet, I know see. Good looking monitor with terrific resolution quality. Ahhh. Back to work!
customer_reviews.author: Opinionated

customer_reviews.title: Warranty is practically useless
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 3 months, awesome color, great blacks, slim bezels, until one day it no longer worked. I woke up in the morning and it was flashing different colors in sequence. I know it has nothing to do with my pc, because it does the same thing even with no input, and none of the buttons (including the power button) work. The internet was no help, and when i contacted acer they told me to ship it to texas to get it replaced, which would have cost over $100 to ship. The monitor may only be defective for a select few, but the fact that they don’t cover the shipping cost renders the warrenty practically useless.
customer_reviews.author: KimSim123

customer_reviews.title: Quality purchase
customer_reviews.text: I needed 2 cost effective, but quality monitors to make my work from home experience similar to that of being in the office. For this price point, I couldn’t believe the quality of these monitors! The picture quality is outstanding and I’ve been able to add the necessary cords for multiple screen utilization with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: SCREEN GREAT/ CONTROL BUTTONS NOT SO GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This screen has great picture and works fine my only gripe is that brightness is a key feature always on screens and they buried it in little menus you have to learn to click into with un-intuitive buttons along the bottom, with plenty of room along the bottom they could have easily put two buttons dedicated to brightness instead of ghosty controls like it has. But it is a beautiful screen and was delivered fast.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Wasil

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Monitor came in and we hooked everything up and it didn’t work. Talked to customer service and they walked me through tech support steps and then told they were sending a new one and a return label for the defective one. Waited for two weeks and nothing came. Contacted customer service again and was told that this model is out of stock and they would have to refund and email me a return label. Very annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great screen; must buy additional parts
customer_reviews.text: This is indeed a good monitor, great brightness, however the HDMI nor the DVI-D cables did NOT come with the unit. I read in the reviews some folks received these cables and others did not. That is the reason for the 3 ratings. If you need HDMI you have to purchase separately. purchase separately.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Some Backlight Bleed
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is beautiful, set up was easy, and price was reasonable. I went for this with no expectations as I know things can go wrong in shipping and manufacturing. The only reason this gets 4 stars is because there is backlight bleed around some of the edges. The bleeding is obvious on a darker (black) screen but is not visible on a more colorful screen. Since my screen is only black when turned off, this is not a huge concern a the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Riss

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Monitors for Home or Office Use - Thin Bevel - Great Size for Work or Gamingf
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these a year and a half ago for my office workstation. I love the thin bevel that makes a side-by-side monitor configuration feel near seamless. The size is perfect for managing a true split screen that allows research to be on one side while writing in a document on the other. The monitor rests stable on the desk, and the round stand base is great for collecting coins, paperclips, etc. The monitor + stand is super thin and doesn't eat up very much footprint on your desk at all. I liked them so much at work that I just purchased 2 of them on my own for my home office.
customer_reviews.author: Hip Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: Great for WFH
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these because we are still working from home. It is so light weight that I felt like the boxes were empty. Its nice and thin and doesnt take much space on your desk. It is also super easy to install I only wish they had a USB-C or HDMI cable included. They only come with VGA cable.
customer_reviews.author: LuvsAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Colors off and dim
customer_reviews.text: I got this to hopefully have a dual monitor setup with better colors than a TN panel Acer monitor I currently have. What I really got was a monitor with worse colors and is dimmer than my old monitor. Pure white has a yellow tint I can't quite get rid of even with spending a bit of time tweaking the settings, at top brightness it is still dimmer than my older monitor, and the colors are muted unless I turn the contrast all the way up which just messes up things that require lowered contrast. I highly recommend against this monitor unless all you need is good viewing angles(which are about the same as my old monitor.)
customer_reviews.author: Stuart A.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 5 months until Black blob with colored vertical and horizontal lines
customer_reviews.text: Acer monitor worked for 5 months. Then a black blob appeared in left top corner with colored vertical and horizontal lines, some flickering, throughout. It's difficult to read spreadsheets through this blob. I don't know why this happened. It's been sitting on top of my desk and used only for 6 hours per day. Other reviewers report that the customer support information is outdated.
customer_reviews.author: Close to Boston

customer_reviews.title: Love Acer monitors
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Acer monitor in about 10 years. The picture quality is great right out of the box. My last Acer was still going strong until the power button started acting crazy. I had to keep pressing it over and over to get it to come on. It was 8 years old and the picture quality was still fantastic. If I could have gotten a new power button I would still be using it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Simply No Complaints, Great For the Price
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is an excellent option for the low price point. The picture quality is excellent and it simply functions as it should. So far there is no wear and tear or any types of malfunctions. Keep in mind you will likely have to buy cables and adapters, but this is no problem considering the monitor itself is so low priced. Keep an eye out for sales, I got mine on Black Friday.
customer_reviews.author: John Lobel

customer_reviews.title: No monitor replacement. they only will help you troubleshoot.
customer_reviews.text: monitor would just turn on/off randomly and end user would get frustrated. Tried everything under google. Move the monitor to new machines problem follows monitor. Obviously a faulty monitor as the other ones I have ordered I have had no issues. Acer support said they do not offer any replacements. Monitor 2 months old and no replacement. Buy another product from a vendor that stands behind their product for at least 1 year!
customer_reviews.author: D. rick

customer_reviews.title: Price changes erratically.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for 149.99 two days ago. Once i got it i decided it was a great monitor. I love it! 5/5. So i went to order another so i can have the duel monitor set up, and they upped the price by 50$ to 200$ in just two days.. Guess i'll just return the original because i didn't want to spend more than 300 on my duel monitors. I ordered just one first to make sure i liked it instead of ordering two at a time. Oh well.. Time to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Some Dude

customer_reviews.title: Best Monitor I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I've had this monitor for over two months now, and it's still functioning nicely. I didn't have to calibrate it or install any special software. Windows 10 recognized it right away. I love the wide screen and the fact that it has HDMI, DVI and VGA inputs. If the display is in "standby" mode, it will automatically switch to the first input that has a signal. But if you have multiple devices sending video signals, you can easily switch between sources using a hardware button along the bottom of the screen. This is the best monitor I've ever owned. It's also the least expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Miles L.

customer_reviews.title: Issues as extension monitor
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these to have a 3 screen setup. However, no matter which one i plug in as the third screen gets distorted centering, meaning that about 2.5 - 3 inches of the screen on one side moves over to the opposite side. Tried may tricks to fix the issue but haven't found a solution yet
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Great, Crisp Picture - Lacks Port Diversity
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is great, picture quality-wise. Super clean lines with vivid colors that make gaming and movie watching enjoyable. Very thin bezel makes the picture pop and will allow this monitor to look sleek in any environment. My only complaint is the lack of ports. There is only one HDMI port, one VGA, one DVI; so I either have to constantly swap out HDMI ports between devices or sacrifice the picture quality or sound with one device and just use DVI/VGA. Granted this monitor was pretty affordable when I bought it, so the price may reflect in the lack of features. Great monitor overall. Just annoying if you plan to use it for more than one device.
customer_reviews.author: DJ TOGG

customer_reviews.title: Good but one single flaw !
customer_reviews.text: This screen its great for office work, for playing video games the image quality and refresh does not help however this still a good monitor for the price. The only problem I found its that you cant adjust the monitor at all, no up/down, left/right, etc. once mounted that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose R.

customer_reviews.title: Great picture for the money
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with this monitor - the display is crisp and clear and very bright. Much better than my last display and the price was great. I only wish it was a little bit bigger. next time I will go bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne C

customer_reviews.title: Monitors w/ DVI, VGA & HDMI options
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. Love having a dual monitor set-up. These also have all three options of inputs: DVI, VGA, and HDMI. However, after about a month, monitors were showing “no signal,” but this was due to the computer having issues not the monitors. Nothing wrong with monitors afterall.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor at the right price!
customer_reviews.text: After using a 17" square LCD monitor for 10 years, I decided it was time for a new wide screen monitor. Because there is very little bezel at the top and sides, this monitor takes up less space than other so-called 24" models. The matte finish is just what I wanted, and colors seem very true. The only con is the difficulty adjusting brightness, etc. with the tiny buttons on the bottom of the screen. I haven't noticed any light spots on dark backgrounds that several had mentioned. In fact, the picture is perfect in my opinion. As usual, the packaging was very protective of the screen, and shipping was fast. I am pleased with both the product and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: B. Alleman

customer_reviews.title: Good picture but has other problem issues.
customer_reviews.text: Picture is good, but the lower left corner has a 3 by 2 inch triangle of where the brightness is different - it looks like a manufacturing defect. One other big thin is that the base sticks way out in front of the monitor unlike any other monitor I have ever owned. It interferes with my keyboard placement and means I have to set the monitor back further than i want to. Also, the blue power light flashes the whole time when the computer is off and the monitor is on and that is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Graham
